alert.note: Alert for Livingston; Washtenaw (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 2:12PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Livingston and western Washtenaw Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 212 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles south of Morrice to near Stockbridge to Cement City. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Fowlerville around 225 PM EDT. Gregory around 230 PM EDT. Chelsea around 240 PM EDT. Pinckney, Cohoctah and Oak Grove around 300 PM EDT. Dexter around 310 PM EDT. Manchester around 315 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Hudson Mills, Parkers Corners, Plainfield, Lyndon Township, Hudson Mills Metropark, Bridgewater, Pleasant Lake, Unadilla, Conway Township and Pinckney State Recreation Area. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
